1 ^ Dòmine: 2 ^ Diriģátur oráțio mea sicut incènsum in conspèctu tuo~; eleváțio mánuum meárum sacrifìcium vespertínum. ^ Let my prayer be directed as incense in thy sight; the lifting up of my hands

qụum clamávero ad te. ^ O Lord: et óstium circumstánțiaĕ lábiîs meîs. ^ Set a watch
and a door round about my lips.

1 ^ Dòmine: 4 ^ Non declínes cor meum in vèrba malìțiaĕ
clamávi ad te: ad excusándas excusațiónes in peccátîs~; cum homìnibus operántibus iniqụitátem
exáŭdi me~; intènde voci meaĕ: et non communicábo cum eléctîs eórum. ^ Incline not my heart to evil words~; to make excuses in sins~; with men that work iniquity
qụum clamávero ad te. ^ O Lord: and I will not communicate with the choicest of them.

clamávi ad te: et increpábit me~; óleum aŭtem peccatóris non impìngụet caput meum
exáŭdi me~; intènde voci meaĕ: qụóniam adhûc et oráțio mea in beneplácitîs eórum. ^ The just man shall correct me in mercy
I have cried to thee: but let not the oil of the sinner fatten my head
hear me; hearken to my voice: for my prayer shall still be against the things with which they are well pleased.

1 ^ Dòmine: 6 ^ Absórpti sunt jûncti pètraĕ júdices eórum~; áŭdient vèrba mea qụóniam potuérunt. ^ Their judges
exáŭdi me~; intènde voci meaĕ: have been swallowed up; They shall hear my words

1 ^ Dòmine: 7 ^ sicut crassitúdo terraĕ erùpta est super terram
clamávi ad te: dissipáta sunt òssua nostra sècus infèrnum. ^ As when the thickness of the earth is broken up upon the ground
exáŭdi me~; intènde voci meaĕ: our bones are scattered by the side of hell.
Dòmine òculi mei~; in te sperávi
qụum clamávero ad te. ^ O Lord: non áŭferas ánimam meam. ^ But to thee
are my eyes; in thee have I put my trust

exáŭdi me~; intènde voci meaĕ: et a scándalîs operántium iniqụitátem. ^ Keep me from the snare
qụum clamávero ad te. ^ O Lord: which they have laid for me
I have cried to thee: and from the stumblingblocks of them that work iniquity.

1 ^ Dòmine: 10 ^ Cadent in rețiáculo ejus peccatóres~; singuláriter sum ego donec transeam. ^ The wicked shall fall in his net; I am alone until I pass.
